courses.subject: Free Elective
courses.customDesc:
Any Free Elective course can go here.

CHEM124 and CHEM125 are recommended.

courses.subject: Free Elective
courses.customDesc:
Any Free Elective course can go here.

Supplemental Workshops (SCM150 & MATH151, MATH152, MATH153) are recommended in your first year. They may require concurrent enrollment in the associated courses, and they count toward free elective credit.

courses.subject: Free Elective
courses.customDesc:

courses.subject: Free Elective
courses.customDesc:

Supplemental Workshops (SCM150 & MATH151, MATH152, MATH153) are recommended in your first year. They may require concurrent enrollment in the associated courses, and they count toward free elective credit.

courses.subject: Breadth Elective
courses.customDesc: Any Breadth Elective course can go here. Complete a total of 22 units of Approved Electives. Select one course from Laboratory (1-4 units), 14 units from Technical, and 7 units from Breadth. See Catalog for more course options. Laboratory Elective: ASTR444; PHYS323, PHYS340, PHYS341, PHYS357, PHYS422, PHYS423, PHYS426, PHYS428. (Units in excess of 1 unit will count towards Technical Elective units.) Technical Elective: HIST350; PHIL341, PHIL323, PHIL421; Any 300-400 level courses with PHYS, ASTR, or GEOL prefix. (Excess units will count towards Breadth Elective units.) Breadth Elective: Select 7 units from any 300-400 level course or PHYS220. Total combined elective credit in PHYS400, PHYS404, ASTR400, ASTR404, GEOL400, and GEOL404 limited to 8 units, with a maximum of 2 units per quarter. PHYS220 recommended in the Fall of sophomore year.

courses.subject: Free Elective
courses.customDesc:
Any Free Elective course can go here.

Supplemental Workshops (SCM150 & MATH151, MATH152, MATH153) are recommended in your first year. They may require concurrent enrollment in the associated courses, and they count toward free elective credit.

courses.subject: Choose One
courses.customDesc: Choose one of the following: PHYS206, or PHYS202.

courses.subject: GE
courses.customDesc: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B2, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division C and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to current catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, or E.

Any Free Elective course can go here.

At least 8 units must be upper-division (300-400 level).

courses.subject: Technical Elective
courses.customDesc: Any Technical Elective course can go here. Complete a total of 22 units of Approved Electives. Select one course from Laboratory (1-4 units), 14 units from Technical, and 7 units from Breadth. See Catalog for more course options. Laboratory Elective: ASTR444; PHYS323, PHYS340, PHYS341, PHYS357, PHYS422, PHYS423, PHYS426, PHYS428. (Units in excess of 1 unit will count towards Technical Elective units.) Technical Elective: HIST350; PHIL341, PHIL323, PHIL421; Any 300-400 level courses with PHYS, ASTR, or GEOL prefix. (Excess units will count towards Breadth Elective units.) Breadth Elective: Select 7 units from any 300-400 level course or PHYS220. Total combined elective credit in PHYS400, PHYS404, ASTR400, ASTR404, GEOL400, and GEOL404 limited to 8 units, with a maximum of 2 units per quarter. PHIL321 or PHIL323 will meet the Upper-Division C requirement; HIST350 will meet the Upper-Division D requirement. If one of these is selected, increase your total free electives by 4 units. PHYS321 recommended in the Winter of junior year.

courses.subject: Graduation Writing Requirement
courses.customDesc: Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
